title: Why do people get so upset when you compliment them on their lucky game?
body: I would have thought winning the game was a good thing, no?

replies.body: Because telling someone they had a lucky victory is not a compliment, it's a backhanded insult generally used to mean they don't deserve their victory.
What do you mean "Lucky"? Like you are saying congrats on the lucky win? If so I'm sure you can figure out why they would get upset when you say that.

I  mean 'lucky' as in, congratulations on you being the lucky team to win this time much like I compliment my team on our luck when we win.  

I'm not sure how that is a bad thing.

I don't see it, sorry.  You literally just click an enemy to attack them, or press a button for an ability and use it.  Most abilities in the game are luck shots as it is.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Michael of 8,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=vMPvElNo,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-25T20:20:04.261+0000)
>
> I don't see it, sorry.  You literally just click an enemy to attack them, or press a button for an ability and use it.  Most abilities in the game are luck shots as it is.

Yes and doing that with precision is a skill. What dont you see? Lol i dont get it. Typing is a fucking skill. So is manipulating digital sprites on a screen in a precise manner. A "luck shot" would be something that shoots in a random direction and its just a matter of luck that it hits someone. A "skill shot" is where YOU direct the shot at a moving (or hell, maybe the target is immobile, which would take less SKILL to hit) target with the goal of hitting said target.

If the game was pure luck like a slot machine, then my 5 year old nephews could beat me or you. Thats not the case with this game, but I bet they could win more than me at an actual luck based game like slots, because thats just based on luck. 

In League, they would click around randomly because they dont have the skill and knowledge of the game to make good decisions, and then actually execute (the skill part) actions based on those decisions. Of course there is skill involved. I dont know how someone could be so blind not to recognize that.

A luck shot is a shot that has no specific target and it is luck whether it hits your target.  You control the shot but it is luck whether you hit the target because the target isn't stationary or moving in a predictable way.  

If the target were stationary or moving in a predictable way then you could call it skill, but champs don't move predictably so it's luck.

I'm not sure how someone could be so blind not to recognise that since it's so obvious!
Lucky would mean he didn't deserve to win due to his weak skills but had teammates hard carry him out to victory. Which isn't a pleasurable experience.
This game doesn't require skill, just luck.
it depends on the game/teammates so yes luck has a factor in it since you cant pull a jesus christ direct control on all friendly champs.
